org.js4ms.net.ip
Class IPExtensionHeader

java.lang.Object
  org.js4ms.util.logging.LoggableBase
      org.js4ms.util.buffer.BufferBackedObject
          org.js4ms.net.ip.IPExtensionHeader
All Implemented Interfaces:
IPMessage, Loggable
Direct Known Subclasses:
IPAuthenticationHeader, IPv6FragmentHeader, IPv6OptionsHeader, IPv6RoutingHeader
public class IPExtensionHeader
extends BufferBackedObject
implements IPMessage

Represents an IP extension header. Used as a base class for classes that represent specific header types, or used to represent a generic, unparsed header.

Header Format

   0               1               2               3
  +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
  |  Next Header  |  Hdr Ext Len  |                               |
  +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+                               +
  |                                                               |
  .                                                               .
  .                                                               .
  .                                                               .
  |                                                               |
  +-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+-+
Next Header Type

Identifies the type of header immediately following the extension header. Uses the same values as the IPv4 Protocol field [RFC-1700].

Header Length

Length of the Hop-by-Hop Options header in 8-octet units, not including the first 8 octets.

Author:
Gregory Bumgardner (gbumgard)

setProtocolNumber

public void setProtocolNumber(byte protocolNumber)
Description copied from interface: IPMessage
Sets the IP protocol number of the message. Most subclasses override this method to do nothing because the protocol number is defined by the message subclass.

Specified by:
setProtocolNumber in interface IPMessage

getNextProtocolNumber

public final byte getNextProtocolNumber()
Description copied from interface: IPMessage
Returns the protocol number value of the next IP message header. If no IP message follows the current message, this method will return a value of IPMessage.NO_NEXT_HEADER. This function is primarily used to return the "Next Header" field in extension headers. See IPExtensionHeader.NextHeader.

Specified by:
getNextProtocolNumber in interface IPMessage
Returns:

setNextProtocolNumber

protected final void setNextProtocolNumber(byte protocolNumber)
Parameters:
protocolNumber -

getHeaderLength

public int getHeaderLength()
Gets the total length of this header in bytes. Some extension headers override this method to return a fixed value.

Specified by:
getHeaderLength in interface IPMessage
Returns:

setHeaderLength

protected final void setHeaderLength(int length)
Sets the total length of this header in bytes. Must be multiple of 8 and greater than 8 since minimum extension header size is 8 octets.

Parameters:
length -
